UserFavoritesList Class Reference

Container for a list of UserFavorites, can store and restore itself in/from a Packet. More...

  • void sortByID ()
    Sort the list contents based on the ID of the favorites.

Detailed Description

Container for a list of UserFavorites, can store and restore itself in/from a Packet.

Definition at line 281 of file UserFavorites.h.

const char *  name,
const char *  shortName,
const char *  description,
const char *  category,
const char *  mapIconName,
const char *  infoStr
) 
 

Add a favorite, full version.

favID is ignored if this favorite is going to be added.

Parameters:
favID The ID of this favorite
lat The latitude of the position
lon The longitude of the position
name The name of this favorite
shortName The short name for this favorite
description The description for this favorite
category The category of this favorite
mapIconName The name of the map icon for this favorite

void UserFavoritesList::addFavorite (  const uint32  favID  ) 
 

Add a favorite with only ID, used for sync list.

Parameters:
favID The ID of the favorite

void UserFavoritesList::addFavorite (  UserFavorite *  userFav  ) 
 

Add an already created favorite.

It will be deleted when the list is deleted.

Parameters:
favID Pointer to a UserFavorite

void UserFavoritesList::restore (  const Packet *  packet,
int &  pos,
bool  onlyID = false
) 
 

Restore a list from a packet.

Parameters:
packet The packet to restore this list from
pos Reference the position to use, will point to the next pos after this favorite when the constructor is done
onlyID Assume that only the ID has been stored in the packet

Store the list in a packet.

Parameters:
packet The packet to store this list in
pos Reference the position to use, will point to the next pos after this favorite when the constructor is done
onlyID Store only the ID in the packet
